tool_description: Intellexer API includes natural language processing solutions for sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, summarization, keywords extraction, document comparison, file conversion, natural language interface for search engines, language detection, spell-checking, article and concepts extraction,  etc.
name: Intellexer Natural Language Processing and Text Mining
title: Intellexer Natural Language Processing and Text Mining
tool_name: Intellexer Natural Language Processing and Text Mining

api_list.name: Comparison of urls

required_parameters.name: url1
required_parameters.description: The URL/Network path to the document to parse.

required_parameters.name: url2
required_parameters.description: The URL/Network path to the document to parse.

api_list.name: Summarization of urls
api_list.description: Return summary data for a document from a given URL.

required_parameters.name: summaryrestriction
required_parameters.description: Determine size of a summary measured in sentences.

optional_parameters.name: structure
optional_parameters.description: Specify structure of the document (News Article, Research Paper, Patent or General).

optional_parameters.name: conceptsrestriction
optional_parameters.description: Determine the length of a concept tree.

optional_parameters.name: loadconceptstree
optional_parameters.description: Load a tree of concepts (FALSE by default).

optional_parameters.name: loadnamedentitytree
optional_parameters.description: Load a tree of Named Entities (FALSE by default).

optional_parameters.name: returnedtopicscount
optional_parameters.description: Determine max count of document topics to return.

optional_parameters.name: usepercentrestriction
optional_parameters.description: Use percentage of the number of sentences in the original text instead of the exact number of sentences.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://intellexer.p.rapidapi.com/summarize?url=http://www.infoplease.com/biography/var/barackobama.html&loadConceptsTree=True&loadNamedEntityTree=True&summaryRestriction=10&usePercentRestriction=True&conceptsRestriction=10&structure=General&returnedTopicsCount=3&fullTextTrees=True"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "intellexer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://intellexer.p.rapidapi.com/summarize?url={url}&loadConceptsTree={loadconceptstree}&loadNamedEntityTree={loadnamedentitytree}&summaryRestriction={summaryrestriction}&usePercentRestriction={usepercentrestriction}&conceptsRestriction={conceptsrestriction}&structure={structure}&returnedTopicsCount={returnedtopicscount}&fullTextTrees={fulltexttrees}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "intellexer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Concept Extraction from urls
api_list.description: Return tree of concepts for a document from a given URL.

required_parameters.name: conceptsRestriction
required_parameters.description: Determine the length of a concept tree.

api_list.name: Named Entity Recognition from urls
api_list.description: Load named entities (personal names, names of organizations, geographical locations, positions/occupations, etc.) from a document from a given URL.

optional_parameters.name: loadrelationstree
optional_parameters.description: Load tree of relations (FALSE by default).

api_list.name: Text Extraction from urls
api_list.description: Parse URL and extract content in the form of plain text.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://intellexer.p.rapidapi.com/parse?url=http://www.euronews.com/2012/01/02/ailing-mubarak-back-in-court/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "intellexer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://intellexer.p.rapidapi.com/parse?url={url}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "intellexer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
